Description: Bronze lamp with a shallow bowl body and two long flat-topped splayed and fluked nozzles with semicircular wick-holes, scalloped at the junction with the body underneath. The very wide filling-hole is stepped for a lid (now lost). At the rear is a flat ring handle with a small floral ornament above, supported by acanthus-leaves, slightly damaged. On each side of the lamp are two rosettes rising from curved spines; between the nozzles is another rosette on a straight spine. The lamp stands on a small circular sunken base. The surface is pitted and the body cracked and holed.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3556)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
